newsitem.title: CANADA: Ulster Pete in C$84 mln Alberta land deal.
newsitem.headline: Ulster Pete in C$84 mln Alberta land deal.

text.p: Ulster Petroleums Ltd said on Thursday it agreed to buy a stake in 170,000 acres of mineral rights in Alberta's Peace River Arch region for C$84 million.
Ulster said the purchase would include an average 43 percent working interest in the Wapiti area in the northern part of the province.

A 30 percent operating interest in 350 million cubic feet per day of processing facilities and a 250 mile pipeline system -- which effectively controls all production at Wapiti -- were also part of the deal, the company said.

"This acquisition, together with our offsetting 150,000 acres at Gold Creek and Knopcik, makes Ulster the dominant land holder in one of the most exciting and competitive exploration plays in the province of Alberta," Ulster president Fred Woods said in a statement.
Woods said the company set a target for the region to produce 150 million cubic feet per day of gas in two years.
Current net production was 23 million cubic feet a day of gas and 1,000 barrels of liquids, Ulster said.
The new lands were estimated to harbor proven plus probable reserves of 74 billion cubic feet of gas and four million barrels of oil and gas liquids.
The deal, still subject to due diligence, was to be financed from lines of credit and proceeds from the sale of Ulster's northeastern Alberta gas properties.
The acquisition was expected to close on June 1.
